Reviews.Title: “Value for money for business visit ! Close to metro too !”
Reviews.Author: YTabs
Reviews.Content: Nice room and a spacious nice bathroom ! Close to small bars and restaurants around for evenings to hangout !Walking distance to metro stations to connect to city centre and touristy zones ! Friendly reception , left luggage service and FREE WIFI !

Reviews.Title: “Met all expectations”
Reviews.Author: zicomorris
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner have recently returned from a four night stay at NH Parque Avenidas. We booked the trip as a last minute trip and I'm glad we chose to stay at NH Parque Avenidas. The hotel is inbetween two metro stop both stop no more and a 7 minute walk, the first stop is Parque de las Avenidas and the second stop is Ventas. We found the Ventas stop better as it was only a 20 minute journey into downtown Madrid. The Hotel was everything we needed from good customer service to a lovely fresh clean room every day. I cannot comment on the food as we didn't take up the offer to have food at the restaurant. Although opposite the Hotel was a lovely friendly bar which served food. If I was Madrid again the NH Parques Avenidas would be my hotel of choice. one last tip. Use the swimming pool!!!!! trust be you'll need it

Reviews.Title: “nice swimming pool, close to metro and good breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: pcccc
Reviews.Content: my criteria was to find an hotel with swimmingpool and close to a metro station. there are two metro stations nearby: ventas and parque avenidas. the breakfast is very complete. everything was as we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Yahboo
Reviews.Content: Ignore the negative reviews. We got this hotel for around 40 euros a night room only and it's a bargain. Minibar and safe are standard. The pool is great but you need to go and stand at the door by 11.20 if you want a sunbed- there are only ten. You can get food and drinks brought down, but there is also a nice terrace and a restaurant. There's a bar right outside and a shop for buying water, ice cream etc. You can see the bullring from the front door and the metro system is great. Go go go!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and conveient”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very located close to a Metro stop and in a nice neighborhood. The front desk staff was wonderful. The breakfast had a lot of choices and was beautifully presented. The hotel room was quiet and I slept well. I would recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “NH Hotel Parque Avenidas”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the hotel. It was great value, the staff are friendly, helpful and very polite. The location is good as situated near a few Metro stations and bus routes, also very easy area to walk around, They could do with a few more sunbeds around the pool as they is a bit of race to get a sunbed. I did find it frustrating that they only provide 30 minutes free wifi although they are always happy to provide a code to get a further 30 minutes. WIFI should be free in all hotels...and this is a business hotel. Also some of the amenities listed on the website are not available in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Clean and Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ForeveRed
Reviews.Content: Eight of us just been over to see "The Boss" Springsteen. I was a bit worried about some of the reviews on here as I organised the trip - some sad people around I'm afraid! For less than £45 per room per night in one of the most prominent cities in the world, easy access to the city via two very close tube stations and local buses with plenty of cafe bars adjacent to the hotel. The staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble, the rooms were spacious and well-maintained and the pool was a great relief in the ninety degree heat! A great hotel, especially if you are travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “No my preferred NH option”
Reviews.Author: FairEvaluator
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to the metro (10 minutes walk) what is good. The stuff was correct but not warm at all. Even though it is within the NH standards (modern, clean etc) I found two issues that I did not like about this hotel. One, when I tried to open the window It did not remain open since the system was broken, so I had to hold the heavy window open manually for few minutes. The second and worst, I found black mold in the bath corners and a light musty smell. The room was small, the full size bed almost took the entire space. It was looking to the swimming pool side and it was very quiet ( the area itself is quiet). Bed was comfortable and the heating system was working well. I got 30 minutes free wi-fi in the lobby area only, where a access code is provided at the reception. The breakfast was very expensive so I did not try. I think this hotel requires a better maintenance and / or renovation. Before returning, I would explore other options

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but it lacks maintenance”
Reviews.Author: MADHard
Reviews.Content: NH Parque Avenidas is in a quiet area near Plaza de Toros de Las Ventas, 5 to 10 minute walk. The first impression wasn't really good, the main door is kind of hidden and there's a HUGE column right in the middle of the entrance. WTF? It's located in a quiet and calm residential area, so forget about going dinner to the next corner. During the day, buses (43, 53 or 74) are the best option. From 2:00 a.m. every half an hour, there's a line (N3) from Cibeles that has a stop at the front door. It's clean. What for me is most important in a city hotel. There're stairs to get to the breakfast lounge, so wheelchairs will have to take an alternative route to sit with the rest of the family. Breakfast buffet had a bit of everything. Healthy food only, I couldn't find fried eggs, bacon or sausages. In the pictures taken is visible the lack of maintenance mentioned. Cracks and moisture on bathroom ceiling, and a DIY wiring for the dryer (wich didn't work at all). There weren't enough visible wall outlets in the room. There were two blocked by the bed, another one for the kettle and the only really usable was the one for the vacuum cleaner, what made us leave the phones and tablet charging on the floor. Spanish hotels should offer free WiFi to their clients IN THE ROOM. It's nonsense to charge nowadays for an Internet connection. The rooms are not acoustically isolated. Not as they should be. We arrived at about 2 a.m. and could hear a couple for about an hour. She was really loud. My wife and I spent there just the scheduled night. That's why all the above wasn't a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, rude staff, clean room”
Reviews.Author: gerbilonwheels
Reviews.Content: Things you should know: 1. You have to pay for internet unless you sit in the lobby and then you only get it in 30 min increments. 2. Breakfast is 16 euros per person 3. It's located in an older residential area of Madrid so you must metro everywhere. 4. Staff are very rude and seem burdened by communicating with English speaking guests. I had higher hopes for this hotel. The staff are very rude though. They don't offer much advice when asked and act like dealing with you is a burden. While sitting on a couch, I had a stockinged foot (no show) tucked underneath me. The front desk attendant came up and physically pulled my foot to the floor without asking me to move it. I'm glad that their free toiletries smell nice, but I would much rather have politeness and free internet in my room. I wouldn't recommend staying here, but it isn't dirty and isn't the worst you could do.

Reviews.Title: “A sad hotel in a sad environment”
Reviews.Author: Rodukas
Reviews.Content: First impression when you enter the hotel : a massive pillar right in the middle of the entrance, that you have to avoid if you want to enter. The rest of the hotel is similar : small, badly conceived, impersonal. Rooms are noisy, I did not have any pleasure staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Alexcub21
Reviews.Content: I spend one night there and I make a phone call that I didn't even got connected and the next day they charge me 5 euros because of 14 seconds phone call, so be careful don't touch the phone. The rooms are very small and they always give you twin beds Insted of a normal bed, horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Down-to-earth, excellent service, easy transport to city”
Reviews.Author: AJLDevon
Reviews.Content: Nh Parque Avenida was all we needed it to be. It was great to relax in the sheltered grassy pool area by day and then catch the bus or metro into the city to enjoy the galleries and museums later. The hotel is situated just outside the city in a down-to-earth area which we quite enjoyed. We wanted somewhere quiet so we spent a little extra for a room which overlooked the swimming pool rather than the street and we think this was worth it as it was really peaceful. We loved the pool area although it was true you did have to do rush down there just before opening time to make sure you got a lounger but we don't think the hotel could or should have crammed in lots more so we didn't mind when on the odd occasion we had to use a towel. We also enjoyed the daily poolside barbecue which was tasty and cheaply priced with friendly service. We discovered that the galleries (the main reason for our stay) were free to EU citizens at certain times during evenings so each night we travelled into the city, about 20 minutes easy journey to the galleries (if you are an art fan we would recommend you indulge yourself by visiting the main museums more than once if you are able). The bus stop is just a minute's walk from the hotel. We decided mostly though to use the Metro which was five minutes away at the rather spectacular Bullring. We were amazed at how cheap and efficient transport is. You can buy a ticket for 10 journeys which you can share with other people which works out a bit cheaper than single journeys which are €1 each to anywhere in the city (did you hear that London transport???) We had a small problem with some ants in our room (not uncommon in Spain) which we notified the staff of. They couldn't be swifter or more helpful. Despite the fact it hadn't bothered us that much and that the problem had been resolved immediately the next day the manager personally apologised and offered us a free evening meal which was delicious and extremely generous. In general we found the staff really friendly and helpful and we very much enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: steelered42
Reviews.Content: Stayed over a week here, wonderful hotel. The morning buffet was excellent, plenty of options. Rooms were clean and very nice. The staff very helpful, and always accomodating. Hotel is close to 'Ventas' subway station, which connects you to Madrid. The best subway system in the world. There are two buses that leave from the hotel, also excellent way to get to the center of Madrid, 15 minutes away. Overall very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethIre
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the NH in Aug for two nights. It was central to the park retiero and many other landmarks. It was clean and just like a good hotel. Breakfast was very good, it would have been better if the pool was bigger with more sun loungers. The staff were excellent and we enjoyed our stay here :)

Reviews.Title: “recommended for football match”
Reviews.Author: svetobeh
Reviews.Content: Typical chain hotel, 15 minutes by bus from Santiago Bernabeu stadium. We choose this hotel because of the proximity to the football stadium which was the main reason of our visit. We were not dissapointed at all, but if our main interest was sightseeing we would probably choose different hotel, closer to the city centre. You can buy breakfast during the check-in for discount price and we wound do that again. Be aware you know exactly what is the name or address of the HN hotel, since there are probably dozens of them in Madrid... You will avoid to pay about 150 euros for taxi when you are coming back from nightlife, like some "lucky" members of our group...

Reviews.Title: “Clean and tidy, not a bad location”
Reviews.Author: AberystwythWelshgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights a while ago now, and had a good time. The hotel itself was clean and welcoming, and the rooms where air-conditioned well. It is very near the Bull-fighting ring, and therefore the Metro - which is the easiest underground system I have ever encountered!! Unfortunately the Swimming pool did have limited hours, which was slightly weird! Recomended

Reviews.Title: “we got an excellent price/quality ratio. Hotel was perfect for us.”
Reviews.Author: olacomo
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel in calm and pleasant neighbourhood, 15-20 min. from city center, a few hundred meters behind the main bullfight arena. Two bus lines stop just feet away and go to center. Metro stations 10 min. away. Also well situated because not far to/from airport. Staff extremely friendly and helpful, cleaning well done too. Wi-fi was offered in half-hour vouchers and worked well (not high broadband though, but we were on vacation). Pool was not open yet but will be in summer. Pleasant and tasty buffet breakfast. Overall, we would be happy to come back (because Madrid is a very interesting, clean, pleasant, apparently safe, affordable and cultured city) and this hotel was a good choice. Thanks, M******, for finding it !

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: paulbiehl
Reviews.Content: It is very close to the metro station that is by the bull fighting ring, maybe a ten minute walk (the metro is awesome). It was off the touristy path so we got a nice break from the crowds every time we went back to the hotel. It was little, but that's to be expected, we were in europe. The floors were wood, the bed was comfortable. The shower was odd, not bad but odd. It didn't have a curtain or a sliding glass door, just glass over the half of the side with the shower head. The other half was just open. We loved our two day stay here. We wish all the hotels we'd been to in europe were this nice.

Reviews.Title: “WATCH OUT FOR THIEVES!”
Reviews.Author: reniram
Reviews.Content: Medium level hotel located quite far from downtown, but well connected. Arrived in the morning, my wife and me were suggested to wait for a few minutes in the hall because the room wasn’t ready yet. After a short while, our room was put at our disposal, but I noticed that the bag containing my PC and all my working papers (I was there for an important meeting), which I had put aside the armchair I was seating on, had been stolen. The CCTV tape, quickly checked, showed two guys entering without any control into the hall, searching for some valuable to be snatched, catching my bag and exiting calmly without any hindrance. Even if the theft was carried out in an area pertaining to the hotel, therefore to be considered protected, they refused any kind of reimbursement or easiness. Thus, if you go there, watch out for thieves!

Reviews.Title: “disappointing staff - urgently need new furniture”
Reviews.Author: Jacopone
Reviews.Content: I am usuall quite satisfied when I stay in a NH hotel, I trust this chain: hotels are not that charmy and they always look very similar, independently where you are. But, basically you are guaranteed of a good quality staff, rooms and amenities. Unfortunately this hotel has some of the worst staff I have ever experienced in my life. During my stay they were always very rude and seem to be disappointed when asked something, and this is not because of the language or me: i addressed them both in English and Spanish, and i observed how they deal with other customers...always in a very impolite way. Another minus is that rooms have very old furniture. For the price i payed i would have expected something more in line with usually high NH standards. The hotel is located at walking distance (10-15 minutes) from metro stop VENTAS (plaza de toros) but i would not suggest to go there if you are staying in Madrid for turism. It is too far away from any lively part of the city and, at the same time, far away from monuments and places of interest. The location, instead, is very good if you have to go to barrio de salamanca.

Reviews.Title: “Not one of the better NH properties”
Reviews.Author: alella
Reviews.Content: I am generally fond of NH hotels, and had consistently good experiences with the brand until now, but this property was quite disappointing. The reserved room was not prepared at the time of check-in. In order to access a room without a delay we had to agree to an upsell of €15 to a "superior room" (which hardly seemed superior). Somewhat older and run-down, with a distinct sewer odor to the rooms (we checked a couple). The rooms were generally very stuffy, with no air conditioning available (apparently they had already switched the master system to heat-only, despite the warm weather). Upon check-out, they tried to charge us for two days of parking even though we had stayed only one night, and it took quite some time and persistence to get that straightened out. The small lobby had little atmosphere as it seemed to be always occupied by either a large and loud Chinese tour group, or airline crews (and actually I am a bit surprised that the airlines wouldn't have provided a better hotel for their employees). The hallway was littered with room-service trays that sat for many hours without being picked up. The already-extremely-cramped parking spaces in the garage were further squeezed by lots of meeting-room furniture being stored in what should have been car space. The usual lovely NH bathroom amenities were about the only sign I saw that this property was an NH hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ruralgeorge
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from this hotel after a short break and were pleasantly surprised at just how great this hotel was. Having never stayed in an nh hotel before combined with re fact that we got a great deal with last minute.com we weren't expecting anything to great however this really is an excellent standard of hotel. The location is just 15 minutes from the centre of madridand the metro just 2 minutes walk away which is the best public transport I have ever used. The roomsare cleaned to a fantastic standard and my only criticism would be the pool. There are never enough sun loungers. This would not be an issue in most locations but there is just grass that surrounds the pool, so if u put your towel down onto the grass which mixes with the water it's a recipe for a muddy disaster and is not a pleasant experience. All in all though fantastic value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, a little difficult to locate !”
Reviews.Author: cerbera69
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night at the hotel. Rooms have a polished wooden floor which is nice, but every time you sit on the bed ... it moves !!. Beds comfortable, some mould around the sealer in the bathroom, but generally a good condition and clean. Staff very helpful, even if they donot quite understand what you are asking, they will try and help. Room Service ok, but in general, not the same quality of food as I would expect say in a northern European hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a good location would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Panther69
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered a multitude of facilities including a pool and tennis courts. A five minute walk takes you to the metro and then a further 15 minutes has you in the centre of Madrid - an absolutely ideal situation. If you want to stay locally there are plenty of bars and restaurants at a very reasonable price all within a walking distance. After a days sightseeing what could be better than relaxing by the pool which closes at 2030.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Okay Location”
Reviews.Author: klward25
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of three we stayed at in Madrid during a recent visit to Spain. Overall, I agree with the majority of the other reviewers. The hotel itself is great. Rooms are clean, modern, and comfortable, and breakfast was the best we had during our two weeks in Spain. The only problem is that the hotel, while close to the central business district, is quite far from any of the tourists sights (Prado, Retiro Park, etc). The Metro stop Ventas is about 5 blocks away, and you have to walk around the bull ring to get there. There are other hotels in the Ventas neighborhood that are of equal quality which are more convenient in terms of transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: Hulah
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a hen weekend in Madrid when we stayed at the Parque Avenidas. We got stung in the taxi from the airport so bear in mind you shouldn't pay more that 25 euros max. The hotel was extremely clean and the rooms were smart and modern, if a little on the small side. The staff were all very pleasant and always smiled and greeted you. The best thing about the hotel was the food and drink. We were very well looked after the whole time. Breakfast was everything under the sun including an expansive range of pastries, cold meats, cheese and cereal and if you wanted eggs and other cooked food they would do it for you on request. The fact that breakfast lasted until 12noon was great and meant lunch wasn't reallt necessary. The pool was good. Not many sun loungers but free towels which was a bonus. Overall, we had a fantastic stay here at an extremely reasonable price. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: Chase24
Reviews.Content: Surprised by the other reviews of this hotel. There was a lot that wasn't up to standard: the rooms were small; the breakfast buffet was held in a marquee behind the hotel (it was freezing outside so not much better in the tent), and the security guard in the small lobby felt slightly threatening. Worst of all, they have plastered an advert for a motor car on the glass entry door and the lift doors. This sort of grubby commercialism might be ok in a budget hotel but is intrusive and offensive in a place like this! Avoid if you can.

Reviews.Title: “A nice business hotel, good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: mrtourne
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the NH Parque Avenidas twice in the last two months, for a total of 4 weeks, so I guess that would make me a regular. While not a stellar, high-end pampering hotel, the NH Parque Avenidas really does the job for business travelers, especially if you are working close by. And at under 100 Euros a night (our corporate rate is 80, but I've seen nightly rates on their website as low as 60 Euros at times), it definitely fits the bill First of all, a word on location - The NH Parque Avenidas is not close to downtown by any stretch of the imagination. So if you want to walk out and have all the sights at your feet, look elsewhere. It is near the Ventas bullfighting ring, which is a bit to the northeast of downtown at the end of Calle de Alcala. This being a residential neighborhood it's fairly quiet (especially on sundays, when surrounding shops are closed), but it has easy access to 3 metro lines (2 & 5 at Ventas and 7 at Parque Avenidas station) which will give you great, fast access to downtown, Calle Goya, el Rastro on a weekend, and the airport (though the airport ride takes a bit of metro hopping). There's a small Dia supermarket 2 blocks away, which can provide you with snacks, drinks, water, etc. so that's also a nice plus. The rooms are fairly standard, corporate decor (think Courtyard) with light wood fixtures and LCD TVs. Non-smoking rooms are on the 3rd and 7th floors, so bear that in mind. The windows can be opened (a big plus on any hotel in Europe, as they usually won't run the AC in winter and I like my room cool). If possible I'd suggest a high floor, as if you are on the street side you will hear the trash collection around 11 PM and on the opposite side you may get music noise from any parties thrown in their conference facilities (this was, I imagine, more of a seasonal inconvenience - being December and all). There's good Wi-fi coverage for a fee in all rooms (22 EUR a day, or 88 EUR for a 7 day stretch). There's also a fridge in your room that can hold a few extra items of your own without having to rearrange everything they packed in. The bathrooms are large and well appointed, with strong showers. The staff is very friendly and will be able to direct you on pretty much any question. They can call cabs to the stop in front of the hotel if there's not one there already (word of caution: rush hour will mean a long wait), or reserve one for an early ride (especially if you are going to the airport in the early morning). I only had one dispute on my bill for a charge I didn't incur, and they solved it quickly and without incident. All in all, I like staying here - it's comfy, no fuss and easy. Yes, I wish there were some more options around, but the Metro takes care of that when I get antsy. Likes: - Quiet area, close to a supermarket - Great metro access, which can take you places very quickly - Room service is fairly inexpensive - Good Wi-fi coverage - Nice surroundings if you like walking - Cleaning service passes a few times, even on weekends - they'll eventually get to you no matter how late you slept in. Some dislikes: - Few restaurants in walking distance - Taxis can be scarce at peak morning times (think 8:15 to 9:30 AM) - Restaurant is very basic, not a lot of options on room service menu - TV could use a couple more options in English for international travelers

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Good Price”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasSteve
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern and clean. The rooms are on the small side. There only 2 english TV stations and limited english pay per view. The staff was hit and miss. Some were very helpful and kind while others would get annoyed with my broken spanish. The hotel website states they have 24 hour room service, this is not accurate. They have a very limited room service menu with limited hours. I stayed for 6 days on business. The wireless internet connection is good, but there is a daily or weekly charge. The bathroom was clean and on the large side from what I have seen in Europe. The neighborhood is limited on shops and restaurants, but it was a short cab ride anywhere in the city. I would stay here again for business due to the location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome...wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: BUNSTERBOO
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a five day stay at the Parque Avenidas and what can i say it was wonderful. We had booked the shuttle service with Aero city to get to and from the hotel. This system was very efficient and worked well and only cost 17 euros each way which was much cheaper than a taxi. The driver arrived 5 minutes early for our pickup and it was 3.30am so we were impressed by the service. Check in at the hotel was easy and all the staff were very polite and spoke good english. The room was modern with a nice spacious bathroom and all usual amenities i.e minibar, satelite TV, chocolate on your pillow each day, Free smint mints, hairdryer (which was pretty powerful for a hotel hairdryer) very good aircon system, free in room safe and all the usual smellies in the bathroom (including toothbrush, toothpaste, razor & comb) The room was cleaned daily with new towells daily and the bedding was changed every other day. The pool is perfectly adequate and cleaned daily. The area around the pool is well kept and very clean and tidy. The only downside was there was only about 10 sunbeds and over the busy weekend period you had to lay out your towel on the grass but this did not cause us a problem. There are towells provided by the pool for guest use. Drinks are served daily by the pool which were averagely priced for a hotel bar. all you had to do was ask the lifeguard and they were brought to you. We didnt eat at the hotel but the food we saw looked lovely and was reasonably priced. The hotel was a 5 minutes walk for the ventas tube station and the bullring which is amazing to see. Although out of the centre the hotel was well loceated and only 5 stops on the tube from the centre which took about 10 mins. We bought a 10 jouney ticket which you can use on seperate days. This was 6.40 euros and well worth the money. There are lots of good cafes and restaurants within a short walk. Overall i would recommend this hotel to anybody it was wonderful. I only have one very small problem with the hotel .... you cant change travellers cheques at reception and I would expect to be able to do this at a 4 star hotel. but there is a bank 1 minuite walk away so again this didnt cause a problem but could have done if i iIhadnt realised on a weekday as all banks are closed on Saturday and Sunday!. If you are looking for a modern, very clean, quiet hotel with a pool this is definately a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for Madrid”
Reviews.Author: JohnMacQPR
Reviews.Content: I recently visited a friend who has moved back to Spain, and now resides in Madrid. Once I had arranged my visit, her brief was to find me a hotel near her apartment. And did she ever! This hotel was great despite being out of the city centre. Located in a quiet neighbourhood, with all necessary shops, banks etc within 5 minutes walk. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Parque de las Avenidas Metro stop, and a 10 minute walk from Ventas station (past the hugely impressive bullring), giving you 3 lines to get into Madrid's centre. A couple of bus lines run directly outside the hotel too, but I didn't use these and didn't catch any route numbers. If you walk down the Ventas route, you are on Calle de Alcala, a long boulevard taking you into Madrid via a multitude of shops, beautiful architecture and the magnificent Retiro Park. Well worth doing if it's not too hot!! The rooms themselves were well appointed; clean and tidy, with both opening windows and fully functioning AirCon. The TV did what it needed in just about every European language and the mini bar was well stocked and still had room for my own purchases of Coke, water etc. The bathroom was well kept too, and stocked with a selection of toiletries in case anything had been forgotten (like my toothpaste!) In fact, the whole of the hotel was very clean, and the staff were friendly at all times, despite my very broken Spanish (I'll get there in the end!!). I didn't eat in the hotel (breakfast wasn't included in my rate, and as I mentioned, my friend lives nearby), so cannot comment, but would be surprised if it fell short of the quality of everything else. I'd definitely stay here again, which is surely the best guide to a hotel being of high standards. In fact, based in this experience I'm also likely to use the NH Hoteles chain in future too. A very pleasant experience indeed! =0)

HotelInfo.Name: NH Parque Avenidas
HotelInfo.Address: Biarritz 2, 28028 Madrid, Spain
